resource-agent.name: fence_xenapi
resource-agent.shortdesc: Fence agent for Citrix XenServer over XenAPI
resource-agent.longdesc: fence_cxs is an I/O Fencing agent used on Citrix XenServer hosts. It uses the XenAPI, supplied by Citrix, to establish an XML-RPC sesssion to a XenServer host. Once the session is established, further XML-RPC commands are issued in order to switch on, switch off, restart and query the status of virtual machines running on the host.

parameter.name: port
parameter.shortdesc: Physical plug number, name of virtual machine or UUID

parameter.name: session_url
parameter.shortdesc: The URL of the XenServer host.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.shortdesc: Write debug information to given file

parameter.name: separator
parameter.shortdesc: Separator for CSV created by operation list

parameter.name: delay
parameter.shortdesc: Wait X seconds before fencing is started

parameter.name: login_timeout
parameter.shortdesc: Wait X seconds for cmd prompt after login

parameter.name: power_timeout
parameter.shortdesc: Test X seconds for status change after ON/OFF

parameter.name: power_wait
parameter.shortdesc: Wait X seconds after issuing ON/OFF

parameter.name: shell_timeout
parameter.shortdesc: Wait X seconds for cmd prompt after issuing command

parameter.name: retry_on
parameter.shortdesc: Count of attempts to retry power on
